CONTACTS repository contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.find_contacts(query: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with a substring in a firstname, lastname, email or phone.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The substring used for query.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve notes for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.find_contacts_by_date(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with a birthdate within 7 days from current date.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve notes for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

src.repository.contacts.is_anniversary_soon(month, day, n: int)¶

Finds if the anniversary is within n days from current date

Parameters:

  • month – The month of the anniversary.

  • day (Extract) – The day of the anniversary.

  • n – The number of days.

Returns:

Is the anniversary is in the given time period.

Return type:

bool
